# Lists

## Unordered Lists

- Item one
- Item two
- Item three

* Star-style item one
* Star-style item two

+ Plus-style item one
+ Plus-style item two

## Ordered Lists

1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

1. All items
1. Can use
1. The same number

## Nested Lists

- Top level
  - Second level
    - Third level
      - Fourth level
  - Back to second
- Back to top

1. Ordered top
   1. Ordered nested
   2. Another nested
2. Back to top
   - Mixed: unordered inside ordered
   - Another unordered

- Unordered top
  1. Mixed: ordered inside unordered
  2. Another ordered
- Back to unordered

## Lists with Content

- This list item has a paragraph.

  This is the continuation paragraph under the same list item.

- This item has a blockquote:

  > A blockquote inside a list item.

- This item has a code block:

  ```ruby
  def hello
    puts "world"
  end
  ```

- This item has **bold**, *italic*, and `code`.

## Task Lists (Checkboxes)

- [x] Completed task
- [x] Another completed task
- [ ] Incomplete task
- [ ] Another incomplete task

### Nested Task List

- [x] Main task
  - [x] Sub-task completed
  - [ ] Sub-task pending
- [ ] Another main task
  - [ ] All sub-tasks
  - [ ] Are pending
